column5: OK  here's the 1st of 2012---started in 2011 mind you  24 x 36  Titled: "Canadian Gothic"  (Play on farmer couple--American Gothic)
Buy this one from him and hang it in your office , i think it looks like you .......
It is another good one alright  BH
Another awesome piece bushart. Thanks for sharing.
Thanks All Again  Lookin at it--amazing the difference looking at the thumbnail pic and clicking it opened
On the bottom left of the painting, what is the boats name?  Does that have any meaning?    Very cool.

Yup  In real life---My boat is named "Alice E."  The day after I took delivery of my boat in 96 my mother passed away  So I named the boat after her---Alice Elizabeth or E.  She was forever warning me about the dangers of waters and to make sure if there was lightning to get off the lake--so in this way She always would remind me.  So fast forward to my painting------that li'l abbreviated name is something us painters hide in our works from time to time
Yup, thats the stuff of legends.  The "Alice E" .  Thanks for sharing.
Bushhart , why the one blue & one brown ?

Skip---that's the camera---they're both blue  I learn something every day about photographing my paintings----but I talk with other painters and unfortunately----there's sometimes no substitute for real time viewing  I work hard to get it as close as possible but---I'm told internet art may even boil down to monitor calibration.  Welcome to the new age

I've been out in conditions like the ones in the painting...  After being cold and wet all day nothing warms you up like getting the fish your after...  Very "cool" painting... Now I need a coffee to warm me up...
Good going there Mike , hope you made out ok . So Bushart i was'nt seeing things then , neat stuff .
And the brush master is at it again... great work Terrence
